byline.contributor: Chris Buckley reported from Katmandu, and Nida Najar from New Delhi. Hari Kumar contributed reporting from New Delhi.
byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and NIDA NAJAR

abstract: Massive avalanche that destroyed Mount Everest base camp after earthquake in Nepal was big enough to terrify even most experienced mountain climbers; some fear economic hardship if disaster discourages foreign trekkers from coming to scale peak, but others are confident visitors will be back.
lead_paragraph: As rescue efforts were hampered by bad weather, dramatic details emerged about the devastation at the base camp in the wake of an avalanche.

headline.main: A Scene of Destruction After Ice Thunders Into Everest Base Camp
headline.print_headline: A Scene of Destruction After Ice Thunders Into Everest Base Camp

snippet: As rescue efforts were hampered by bad weather, dramatic details emerged about the devastation at the base camp in the wake of an avalanche.
